title: CTRL0000050104 - Transcribed Interview of Ed Martin, (February 23, 2022)

data.text: SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE
JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES,
WASHINGTON, D.C.
DEPOSITION OF:
ED MARTIN (NO-SHOW)
Wednesday, February 23, 2022
Washington, D.C.
The deposition in the above matter was held via Zoom, commencing at 10:00 a.m.
Appearances:
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
STAFF ASSOCIATE
CHIEF CLERK
Well, let's go on the record then.
Today is February 23rd, 2022.
And the time is 10 a.m.
We're virtually
convened for the deposition of Mr. Ed Martin to be conducted by the House Select
Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol.
is
proceeding.
I am the designated select committee staff counsel for this
For the record, it is 10 a.m., and Mr. Martin is not present.
My name
The person
transcribing this proceeding is the House stenographer and notary public authorized to
administer oaths.
On February 2nd, 2022, Chairman Bennie Thompson issued a subpoena to
Mr. Martin to produce documents by February 16th, 2022, and to testify at a deposition
today, February 23rd, 2022, at 10 a.m.
committee's investigation into the facts, circumstances, and causes of the January 6th
attack and issues relating to the peaceful transfer of power in order to identify and
evaluate lessons learned and to recommend to the House and its relevant committees
corrective laws, policies, procedures, rules, or regulations.
The subpoena is in connection with the select
This inquiry includes examination of how various individuals, to include
Mr. Martin, and entities coordinated their activities leading up to the events of
January 6th, 2021.
today.
Mr. Martin has not produced any documents or appeared to testify
I will mark as exhibit 1 and enter into the record the select committee subpoena
to Mr. Martin, included with which are the materials that accompany the subpoena:
namely a letter from the chairman, a document schedule of the accompanying
production instructions, and a copy of the deposition rules.
[Martin Exhibit No. 1
Was marked for identification.]
Included in this exhibit is a document called Document Production
Definition and Instruction; another document, which is a copy of the House Congressional
Record, page H41, dated January 4th, 2021, known as the deposition rules; and a copy of
section 3{b) of the House Resolution 8, dated January 4th, 2021.
I will mark as exhibit 2 and enter into the record proof of service of the February
2nd, 2022, subpoena for Mr. Martin.
[Martin Exhibit No. 2
Was marked for identification.]
This subpoena was served by a Supervisory Deputy U.S. Marshal
on February 8th, 2022, at approximately 12:04 p.m. eastern time.
served Mrs. Carol Martin, Mr. Eric Martin's wife, and she accepted service of the
subpoena on his behalf after calling Mr. Martin.
The U.S. Marshal
I will mark as exhibit 3 and enter into the record an email chain from select
committee staff to Mr. Martin.
[Martin Exhibit No. 3
Was marked for identification.]
In this chain, select committee staff contacted Mr. Martin on
February 16th, February 21st, and February 22nd, informing him of his obligation to
produce documents and sit for a deposition, pursuant to the select committee subpoena.
Additionally, the select committee counsel left voice mails for Mr. Martin on
February 18th and February 22nd, informing him of the document production deadline
and deposition date.
Mr. Martin could attend today's deposition.
The email chain includes a link and directions for how -- for which
With that, I will note for the record that it is 10:03 a.m., eastern time, and
Mr. Martin still has not appeared or communicated to the select committee that he will
appear today as required by the subpoena.
Accordingly, the record is now closed at 10:03 eastern time.
[Whereupon, at 10:03 a.m., the deposition was concluded.]
Thank you.
